key_points: Two students at Farmington High School were charged for allegedly planning a school shooting.
They were charged with a third-degree felony count of conspiracy to commit aggravated battery.
The investigation began after a school resource officer was alerted about the plan by a school administrator.
A plan including a detailed map of the school and a list of supplies for the shooting was uncovered.
Farmington School District and the Farmington Police Department are collaborating closely on the case.
Farmington Superintendent emphasized the importance of community vigilance and reporting suspicious activities.
A third student is under investigation in connection with the alleged shooting plan.
The accused students reportedly did not have access to firearms at their homes.
The information came to light due to a concerned student reporting the plan.
Officials are urging students and parents to report any suspicious activities or concerns.
spokespersons: Steve Hebbe (Police Chief, Farmington Police Department)
